intro: Hieracium kainuense, commonly known as the Kainuense hawkweed, is a flowering plant species native to certain regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as grasslands and roadsides. It produces small, yellowish flowers that are surrounded by a series of bracts. Hieracium kainuense is often found in moist or sandy soils and can be an indicator of specific ecological conditions.
